meanings.definition: To change or adjust the alignment of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to realign the picture frame on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to realign the wheels of the car.
meanings.sent3: Trying to realign the planets for a perfect alignment seemed like a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts started to realign like pieces of a puzzle falling into place.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor guided us to realign our bodies for better posture.

meanings.definition: To make changes in order to bring something back into proper alignment.
meanings.sent1: The chiropractor had to realign my spine.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, we had to realign the fence posts.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he needed to realign his jokes for a better punchline.
meanings.sent4: The team had to realign their strategies to win the game.
meanings.sent5: The teacher helped the student realign his writing to follow the guidelines.

meanings.definition: To adjust or reorganize in order to bring something into a new or different alignment.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to realign its departments for better efficiency.
meanings.sent2: She had to realign her priorities after the unexpected news.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to realign the ingredients to fit the new recipe.
meanings.sent4: The coach realigned the players on the field for a stronger defense.
meanings.sent5: The artist realigned the elements in the painting to create a more balanced composition.
